title.narrative: OPT 4.2. RISK INFORMED PROGRAMING TO PROTECT CHILDREN FROM THE IMPACT OF NATURAL

description.narrative: National and subnational capacities in selected departments are strengthened in risk informed programing to protect children and adolescents, especially the most vulnerable, from the impact of natural disasters and climate change.

sector.narrative: Disaster risk reduction (including linkage to climate change)
Risk informed Programming for resilience (including policy and strategy development)

related-activity.ref: 0510/A0/05/404 OCM 4. EVERY CHILD HAS AN EQUAL CHANCE IN LIFE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National and subnational capacities in selected departments are strengthened in risk informed programing to protect children and adolescents, especially the most vulnerable, from the impact of natural disasters and climate change.

description.narrative: UNICEF is strengthening national government capacities to implement the Plurinational Climate Change Policy and incorporate an evidence-based childhood approach. In addition, UNICEF is working with two local governments to include this approach in their Territorial Climate Change Plan and Strategy. Simultaneously, UNICEF is strengthening the capacities of the Child and Adolescent Departmental and Municipal Committees and the Mother Earth Youth Council to: develop local networks; make local adaptation and mitigation action plans; and participate and exert influence at the national and international level. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: # of local governments that have climate change adaptation strategies and/or programs that consider children and adolescents

target.value: 2022:6 ETA have climate change adaptation strategies and/or programs that consider children and adolescents

title.narrative: # of local governments that have disaggregated information that can be used to generate climate change adaptation and disaster risk reduction policies that consider children and adolescents

target.value: 2021:8 (4 Departaments: La Paz, Cochabamba, Santa Cruz and Pando; 4 Municipalities: El Alto, Independencia, Cobija, Santa Cruz de la Sierra)
